Description: Shoulder sherd of Fikellura pottery oinochoe; glaze fired orange; exterior white-slipped: tongues pendent from base of neck; below, lotus flower and rosette frieze; to right glazed handle zone area; interior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 42' on break (number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80, NAU 42), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 130, Nau 96, pl. 21g)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 242)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 3 R. 15)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-80, 82, 84, fig. 3) (NAU 42)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.105)
